titles.title: Portrait of Elector Friedrich the Wise and his brother Duke John the Steadfast of Saxony

pageContext.description:
Portrait of Elector Friedrich the Wise and his brother Duke Johann the Steadfast of Saxony; in half-length, standing under an arch behind a ledge; two coats of arms in the upper corners.
This engraving served as the title-page to the second edition of the Wittenberg Heiligthumsbuch. This impression exhibits an impression of Cranach's woodcut of the church of All Saints printed on the verso (Hollstein, 96), but the book title in letter print has not survived.
pageContext.dimensions:
Sheet: 13.1 x 11.7 cm
[Exhib. Cat. Düsseldorf 2017, 123, No. 28]

pageContext.signature: Artist's insignia at the bottom on a plaque: winged serpent, facing right with raised wings; dated '1510]'

additionalTextInformation.text:
These portrait engravings predate the first engraved portrait by Dürer, that of Cardinal Albrecht of Brandenburg of 1519. Dürer's engraving served as the title-page of the Hallesche Heiligthumsbuch, published in Halle in 1520, and the designs of the woodcut illustrations in it by Dürer's pupil Wolf Traut were much influenced by Cranach's designs for the Wittenberg Heiligthumsbuch 
[Exhib. Cat. London 1995, No. 177]
